snippet: In rejecting a $612 billion defense policy bill, the president signaled his determination to use it as a bargaining chip to push Republicans to abandon strict spending limits.
abstract: Pres Obama vetoes $612 billion defense spending bill, fifth time he has vetoed any bill since taking office; is sign Obama wishes to use defense bill to prod Republicans in Congress to get rid of spending limits on military and domestic programs.

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
keywords.name: subject

lead_paragraph: In rejecting a $612 billion defense policy bill, the president signaled his determination to use it as a bargaining chip to push Republicans to abandon strict spending limits.

headline.print_headline: In Wielding Rarely Used Veto, President Puts Budget Heat on Republicans
headline.main: In Wielding Rarely Used Veto, President Obama Puts Budget Heat on Republicans
